CatDescriptText: Article accompanying related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 20, 1953, pg. 10, reads: "Doris Green is Pretty Bride - Pretty Doris Green, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alvin Green, of Beltzhoover, became the bride of Ernest Summers in St. Paul AME Church, with the Rev. R. Walker Storms officiating. Given in marriage by her father, the bride wore pleated nylon net gown with a short jacket of lace, to which a three-tiered pleated train was attached.  Her jeweled cap had a shoulder-length veil.  She carried white orchids, surrounded by roses.  Mrs. Olive Cobbs of Philadelphia was the matron of honor.  Thelma Turner, sister of the bride, and Audrey Smith were junior bridesmaids.  The  attendants wore identical dresses.  They had three tier, net skirts, with pleating around the hips and shoulders, and short jackets.  Mrs. Cobbs wore pink and the girls wore aqua. All carried roses.  Best Man.  The best man was Kenneth Harris.  Ushers were Alton Warren, uncle of the bride; Roland Lucas and John Jackson.  Members of the Palsetta Club served as aides.  Coming from Detroit were the groom's mother, Mrs. Lois Sims, and Margie Lee Floyd, his aunt.  Mrs. John R. Caldwell and Mrs. James E. Hawkins attended from Flint, Mich.  After a reception at Loendi Club, the young couple left on a Michigan and Canadian honeymoon. They will reside in Homewood.  The groom presented the bride with a Lincoln car and she gave him a set of luggage as bridal gifts."
TitMainTitle: Bride Doris "Dutch" Green Summers tossing bouquet down stairs, with Abraham Mason wearing glasses, and Richard Barrow on right looking on, in Loendi Club
